title: Japan wins WTO dispute over South Korean bans on Fukushima-related food
text: February 22, 2018 / 3:33 PM / Updated an hour ago Japan wins WTO dispute over South Korean bans on Fukushima-related food Reuters Staff 1 Min Read TOKYO/GENEVA (Reuters) - A World Trade Organization ruling on Thursday largely upheld a Japanese complaint against South Korea’s import bans and additional testing requirements imposed on Japanese seafood because of the 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster. In a ruling that can be appealed by either side, a WTO dispute panel said South Korea’s measures were initially justified but keeping them in place violated the WTO’s sanitary and phyto-sanitary (SPS) agreement, and urged Seoul to take corrective action. Reporting by Yuka Obayashi and Tom Miles; editing by Stephanie Nebehay
